questions.clue: This ancient limestone monument, carved in Egypt around 2500 BCE, depicts a lion with a human head.
Discovered in 1922, this artifact is the solid gold funerary mask of an Egyptian pharaoh.

This object helped scholars unlock the meaning of Egyptian hieroglyphs when it was found in 1799.

categories.name: The Science of Cooking: Kitchen Chemistry

questions.clue: When baking, this ingredient helps dough rise by releasing carbon dioxide gas.
This process denatures proteins in eggs, turning them from liquid to solid.
Often used in breadmaking, this fungus ferments sugars to produce carbon dioxide and ethanol.
The Maillard reaction, crucial for creating flavor and browning, occurs between amino acids and these types of compounds.
This pH-sensitive pigment found in red cabbage can be used as a natural indicator to test acidity or alkalinity in cooking.
She was a pioneering nurse during the Crimean War, known as 'The Lady with the Lamp'.

This mathematician was instrumental in NASA's early success, calculating trajectories for the Mercury and Apollo missions.

In Greek mythology, this underwater city sank because of its people's arrogance and is said to be lost.

categories.name: Alien Invasions: Sci-Fi in Pop Culture

questions.clue: This 1898 H.G. Wells novel features Martians attacking Earth with heat-rays.
In this 1996 film, Earth unites under Will Smith's leadership to defeat an alien threat on July 4th.
In this 1982 Steven Spielberg film, a young boy befriends a kind-hearted extra-terrestrial.
This 1977 novel by Douglas Adams begins with Earth being demolished to make way for a hyperspace bypass.
questions.answer: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

questions.clue: This 1950 short story by Ray Bradbury, later included in "The Martian Chronicles," depicts Earthlings colonizing Mars and facing existential crises.
